channel.title: Searching the text entered in a TextField?
channel.description: Im trying to make it search for something, and then automatically go down to the next line as if pressing enter, then appending text. How exactly would you do this?

item.title: Searching the text entered in a TextField?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ya pretty much what vartankid said.

String searchedText = nameOfField.getText();

if(searchedText.contains("hello")) {
// Do whatever you want here
}

It’s something like that.

Read full topic
item.source: Searching the text entered in a TextField?

item.title: Searching the text entered in a TextField?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:9, topic:122673”][quote author=Frell link=topic=172380.msg1592281#msg1592281 date=1184317487]
Im trying to make it search for something, and then automatically go down to the next line as if pressing enter, then appending text. How exactly would you do this?
[/quote]

Maybe like

String contents = editor.getText();
if (contents.contains("your mom"))
       contents = contents.replace("your mom", "\nyour mom");
editor.setText(contents);

I think that is what you are referring to…[/quote]
thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Searching the text entered in a TextField?

item.title: Searching the text entered in a TextField?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Frell:

Im trying to make it search for something, and then automatically go down to the next line as if pressing enter, then appending text. How exactly would you do this?

Maybe like

String contents = editor.getText();
if (contents.contains("your mom"))
       contents = contents.replace("your mom", "\nyour mom");
editor.setText(contents);

I think that is what you are referring to…

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:3, topic:122673”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=172380.msg1592335#msg1592335 date=1184318546]
Umm… you do:

String stringName = nameOfField.getText();


glad to help, need help searching it just ask :)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 12, 2007, 10:17:44 PM[/size][hr]btw, is this for your new prog?
[/quote]
yup.

lol, i know how to getText, i mean search, like the mopar item list on the client.[/quote]

Do you mean, something like this?

String stringName = nameOfField.getText();

  if (stringName.Contails("hello?")) {
  }

?
